original: Ingelow, Janne Julius (Jules), redaktör, Vetlanda, f. 13/7/91 i Ingels-torps förs., Krist. 1. G. 1. 13-45 m. Maria Hansson; 2. 46 m. Sigrid Goth-nier. Barn: Nils, Tord, Iris o. Kerstin. — Dala lantbr:sk., assist :kurs pä Önnestad 09’-10, självstud., korresp:-kurser. Kontr :assist. i Vetlanda-ortens kontr:fören. 10-13, förest, f. stift. Kumla barnhem o. småbruk 13-15, egen merkantil verksamh. i Vetlanda 15-17, lokalred. f. Smål. Folkblad 17-21, tj :man på Bondeförb. riksorg. i Sthlm 21, red. o. ansv. utg. av bondeförb :tidn. Landsbygden i Falköp. 21-24, start. Sv. Allmogetidskr. 22 o. Sv. Allmogeförlaget 27, som utg. omkr. 500 bokarb. 27-46, lokalred. f. Smål. Alleh. 27-32 o. sed. 34, bedr. omfatt. journ. verksamh. Ordf. i Sv:es hemfbygdsMtt. fören. sed. 3l2, led. av styr. f. hembygds- o. fornminnesfören. Njudung, led. av stadsfullm. i Vetlanda 20-21 o. av fattigv :s’tyr. etc. Led. av Sv. journ :fören. sed. 29. Skr.: Holger Alm (folklivsroman 24), Livets stigar (dikter 25), Sv. Folkförfattare (biogr. kalender i 3 del. 29-38), Arets månader, högtider o. bemärkelsedagar i sed o. folktro (40), Meditationer o. minnen (vers o. prosa 44), regelbundna bidr. t. tidn. o. tidskr. på vers o. prosa, kåserier, berätt., dikter, art. etc. Hoibbies: tidn :urk;lipp, folklore, hembygdsikunskap. Sign.: Per Post.
translated: Ingelow, Janne Julius (Jules), editor, Vetlanda, b. July 13, 1891 in Ingels-torp parish, Kristianstad. Married 1st in 1913 to Maria Hansson; 2nd in 1946 to Sigrid Goth-nier. Children: Nils, Tord, Iris, and Kerstin. Completed agricultural courses at Önnestad in 1909-1910, studied independently, and completed correspondence courses. Assisted with contract work for the Vetlanda district association in 1910-1913. Managed the Kumla orphanage and small farm from 1913-1915, ran his own business in Vetlanda from 1915-1917, and served as local editor for the Småländska Folkbladet from 1917-1921. Worked as an employee of the national Farmers' Association in Stockholm in 1921, then served as editor and publisher of the Farmers' magazine Landsbygden in Falköping from 1921-1924. Founded the Swedish Folk Times in 1922 and the Swedish Folk Publishing Company in 1927, publishing around 500 books from 1927-1946. Served as local editor for the Smålänningen's Allehanda from 1927-1932 and again from 1934 onwards, and engaged in extensive journalistic activities. Served as chairman of the Swedish Local History Society from 1932 and as a member of the board for the local history and antiquarian society Njudung. Served as a member of the Vetlanda city council from 1920-1921 and on the board for the poor relief committee. Became a member of the Swedish Journalist Association in 1929. Wrote Holger Alm (a novel about rural life in 1924), Livets stigar (poetry in 1925), and Swedish Folk Authors (a biographical calendar in 3 parts from 1929-1938), as well as Aret månader, högtider och bemärkelsedagar i sed och folktro (monthly celebrations and folk beliefs in 1940) and Meditationer och minnen (verse and prose in 1944). Contributed regularly to newspapers and magazines in verse and prose, essays, stories, poems, and articles. Had interests in collecting newspaper clippings, folklore, and local history knowledge. Used the pen name Per Post.

memberOf.name: Njudung Local History and Antiquarian Society
